meanings.definition: Not willing to accept views, beliefs, or behavior that differ from one's own.
meanings.sent1: She was intolerant of any ideas that didn't match her own.
meanings.sent2: The intolerant person refused to listen to any opinions different from theirs.
meanings.sent3: The intolerant cat only wanted to play with one specific toy.
meanings.sent4: His intolerant attitude towards change made it hard for him to adapt.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's intolerant behavior towards new teaching methods hindered progress in the classroom.

meanings.definition: Unable to endure or withstand something.
meanings.sent1: The intolerant child couldn't handle spicy food.
meanings.sent2: She was intolerant to extreme temperatures.
meanings.sent3: The intolerant phone battery died after just a few hours.
meanings.sent4: His intolerant skin reacted badly to certain fabrics.
meanings.sent5: The intolerant car engine couldn't handle long drives.

meanings.definition: Showing anger or impatience towards differing opinions or beliefs.
meanings.sent1: He became intolerant whenever someone disagreed with him.
meanings.sent2: The intolerant customer yelled at the waiter for a minor mistake.
meanings.sent3: The intolerant toddler threw a tantrum when offered a different toy.
meanings.sent4: Her intolerant reaction to criticism made others hesitant to speak up.
meanings.sent5: The intolerant boss fired employees for expressing different ideas.
